TER.TERcoder.Weighting
Class ForwardWeighting

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERcoder.Weighting.ForwardWeighting

public class ForwardWeighting
extends java.lang.Object

This class receives an image and weights the specified components.
Usage example:
  construct
  set functions
  run

Version:
1.0
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

Field Detail

imageSamples

float[][][] imageSamples
Image samples (index meaning [z][y][x]).

All values allowed.

zSize

int zSize
Definition in Coder.zSize

ySize

int ySize
Definition in Coder.ySize

xSize

int xSize
Definition in Coder.xSize

customWtFlag

int[] customWtFlag
Weighting type to be applied for each channel..

Valid values are:

  • 0 - CCSDS-Recommended
  • 1 - User defined
  • 2 - None

customWeight

float[][] customWeight
Contains the weights defined by the user.

Any real value is allowed

WTType

int[] WTType
Definition in ForwardWaveletTransform.WTLevels

WTLevels

int[] WTLevels
Definition in ForwardWaveletTransform.WTTypes

parametersSet

boolean parametersSet
To know if parameters are set.

True indicates that they are set otherwise false.

getWeight

public float getWeight(int subband,
                       int channel)
Finds the weight for a given subbands and channel

Parameters:
subband - indicates the subband that requires the weighting factor
channel - indicates the channel that requires the weighting factor
Returns:
a float corresponding to the weigth to be applied in the given subband

weightingRequired

public boolean weightingRequired(int channel)
For a given channel indicates if weigthing must be applied

Parameters:
channel - indicates if the channel that requires the weighting factor
Returns:
a boolean that indicates whether weighting must be applied in the given channel

run

public float[][][] run()
                throws ParameterException
Performs the weighting desired to each component

Returns:
the weighted image
Throws:
ParameterException - when something goes wrong and the weighting must be stopped
